changelog.release_notes: With this release, there's a small branding in the center of the watchface, right under the center.
With 1.3 release, there's yet another twist - there's a small circle in the center that looks like a mounting screw for hands on physical watch.

This update contains 2 small improvements:
- a small dot appears now in the area of midnight hour
- seconds hand moves a little bit off the center, which resembles how hands were fitted in traditional watches

This is very simple watchface based on default tic tic designed and tested using CSS/JSX (React) and exported into C programming language.

If you want to create your own one with different colors please visit: https://pjsx.pl/tictoc.html

data.description: This is mimialistic watchface with hours/minutes/seconds hands based on default tic toc but generated from React/CSS description from https://pjsx.pl/tictoc.html.

latest_release.release_notes: With this release, there's a small branding in the center of the watchface, right under the center.

data.title: TicToc PJSX
